page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY - THE CHURCH
page.content: The ancient church consists of a chancel, nave and 4 bays with Early English and Perpendicular features. The font and pulpit are of unusual design being made of old bench ends. Much of the church was destroyed by lightning in l848 and was rebuilt in l852. The spire, repaired again in l980 and almost unique amid Cornwall's square towers, is an important navigational reference point used by both Trinity House and the RAF as well as fishermen. The spire stands 3OO ft. above sea-level and houses 3 bells. In l980 a fine 'Father' Willis pipe organ was installed. This was formerly built for the library at Lanhydrock House near Bodmin.
